New Records: Virat Kohli hit a record-equalling century for India in the World Cup, equaling Sachin Tendulkar's 49 one-day international hundreds.
Virat Kohli took his tally past 500 runs in the tournament.
Key Match Events: Ravindra Jadeja claimed five wickets as South Africa were skittled for 83 runs in 27.1 overs.
India made 326-5, with Virat Kohli scoring an unbeaten 101 and Shreyas Iyer hitting 77 with seven fours and two sixes.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli marked his 35th birthday with his second century of the World Cup as India thumped South Africa by 243 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Marco Jansen emerged as South Africa's highest scorer with 14 runs.
The match was played at Eden Gardens, with a slow Kolkata wicket affecting the game.
Others: South Africa had already secured their semi-final place but will gain little confidence for the knockout stages.
